text: The President of Georgia (, sakartvelos prezidenti) is the head of state and supreme commander-in-chief. Their role is ceremonial as in many parliamentary democracies. Prime Minister is the head of government. The office was first introduced by the Supreme Council of the Republic of Georgia on 14 April 1991, five days after Georgia's declaration of independence from the Soviet Union.The Law of the Republic of Georgia on the Introduction of the Post of President of the Republic of Georgia . The Parliament of Georgia Archive. Accessed on 17 April 2011 The President serves a five-year term. ==List of Presidents== Name Portrait Took office Left office Time in office Party Election 1 Zviad Gamsakhurdia 14 April 1991 6 January 1992 Round Table—Free Georgia 1991 The office of the president was vacant from January 6, 1992 to November 26, 1995.
